poem:
Diplomats

In the quiet hush  
of maple halls, whisper  
the shadows of intent,   
clandestine  
as the snowfall's  
confession,  
leaves a dusting  
of doubt—  
nations speak  
in murmurs,  
sharp as  
the edge of  
a maple leaf,  
cutting  
through the cold  
of unguarded  
trust.
